intro: Cinchona × erythroderma, commonly known as the red-berried cinchona, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking red or orange berries, which are a distinguishing feature of the species. The plant is native to the Andean regions of South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. The botanical significance of Cinchona × erythroderma lies in its role as a parent species in the development of medicinal cinchona hybrids used for quinine production.
